bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
Description of problem: With the update to Fedora 25 from Fedora 23 I am no longer able to draw maps using python-basemap (python-basemap-1.0.7-12.fc25.x86_64):
I get following traceback:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/home/fhadm/ftpadmin/bin/mirrortraffic.py", line 696, in <module> draw_client_density(dest, client_ips, 'overall') File "/home/fhadm/ftpadmin/bin/mirrortraffic.py", line 81, in draw_client_density m.drawlsmask(ocean_color=(0,0,255,255), land_color=(0,128,0,255), lakes=True) File "/usr/lib64/python2.7/site-packages/mpl_toolkits/basemap/__init__.py", line 3916, in drawlsmask np.concatenate((lsmask_lons,lsmask_lons[1:]+360),1) IndexError: axis 1 out of bounds [0, 1)
Following upstream patch fixes this for me:
https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap/commit/025d4f5bd6f25b79bdbbfd4db1eea23b4ebc4796
python-basemap-1.0.7-14.fc25 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 25. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-8fb579c00a
python-basemap-1.0.7-14.fc24 has been submitted as an update to Fedora 24. https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-89383fe7b0

python-basemap-1.0.7-14.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-8fb579c00a

python-basemap-1.0.7-14.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 testing repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report. See https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/QA:Updates_Testing for instructions on how to install test updates. You can provide feedback for this update here: https://bodhi.fedoraproject.org/updates/FEDORA-2016-89383fe7b0

Thanks for the quick update.
I filed a ticket upstream I had with an old configuration file. Just mentioning it here if someone else stumbles upon upside down maps:
https://github.com/matplotlib/basemap/issues/329
'backend: cairo' resulted in upside down maps. Deleting my matplotlibrc resulted in correct drawn maps again.
python-basemap-1.0.7-14.fc25 has been pushed to the Fedora 25 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
python-basemap-1.0.7-14.fc24 has been pushed to the Fedora 24 stable repository. If problems still persist, please make note of it in this bug report.
